title.narrative: PARENTS AND CAREGIVERS - KNOWLEDGE AND TOOLS

description.narrative: Parents and caregivers have the knowledge and tools to practice positive parenting and provide protection and effective care to children under 6 years of age in the family and community environments., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, children under 6 years of age in situations of exclusion will reach full development in their family and community environments, with inclusive and equitable access to social programmes and services, even in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Capacity and Skills Development for social and behaviour change

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Parents and caregivers have the knowledge and tools to practice positive parenting and provide protection and effective care tochildren under 6 years of age in the family and community environments.

description.narrative: The empowerment of the families of the Child Development Care Approach has enhanced the capacities of interaction with their sons and daughters. This involved 114,680 fathers, mothers in the care of their children, and 85% (502) of the families with children with disabilities supported by Los Pipitos will show an improvement in their attitudes and practices of parenting, care and inclusion. As a result, 87% of children with disabilities have improved their developmental milestones in the areas of social relationships, communication, mobility and cognitive skills. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022
